featureDesc: You have developed an ability to Bind and control Arcane Energy using the strength of your emotions and instincts.

featureDesc: You have harnessed your physical being and its movements to capture and control Arcane Energy.

featureDesc: You can use Sorcery to bind Arcane Energy into a mundane weapon and temporarily cause it to become an item of Arcane Power.
featureBenDesc: As a Partial Action, if you spend one Charge, you may empower a mundane weapon (melee, ranged, or unarmed attack) with a +1d4 Arcane Enhancement bonus to Combat Attack check rolls 10 full rounds. As a free action, you may maintain a weapon so empowered by spending another 1 Charge for each additional 10 rounds. As long as a weapon is empowered, it is considered to be a Magic Weapon.

featureDesc: You have learned to wield Arcane Energy as a destructive force.
featureBenDesc: When using Arcane Magic in combat to deal damage, you may add +1d4 to your Combat check roll.

featureDesc: You may use Sorcery to Bind and Use Arcane Powers of Primal Darkness.
featureBenDesc: As a Standard action, decrease your Current Charge Count by 1 to diminish or remove light from an area with a radius of up to 5' centered on a point that you can see within 30' of yourself. As a free action once per round while Primal Darkness is active, you may increase or decrease the level of darkness within the affected area from dim to complete darkness. Also, while this is active you gain the ability to see in darkness without penalty to your vision. Each round that Primal Darkness is active, you may choose to spend additional Charges to cause all creatures within your Darkness to reduce their Current Ticker Values by 1d4 for each Charge spent this way. You may do this once per round as a Partial Action for as long as your Primal Darkness remains active. You may spend no more than 5 Charges on this action each round. Targeted individuals are allowed a Spiritual Defense Check roll against your Use Magic check in order to negate this loss. Once Manifested, Primal Darkness remains active for 1d4+1 rounds.
featureNote: The effects of this Power will counter the effects from Primal Light and negate the effects of both.

featureDesc: You can use the Arcane Power of Primal Darkness to shroud and protect you.
featureBenDesc: As a Full Round action, decrease your Charge Count by 1d4+1, to Manifest an Arcane Presence of Primal Darkness. This Presence rises up around you to dim the level of all light within your Reach. While near you, others feel a little unsure. While this Presence is active you gain 10% Concealment against all Ranged and Melee attacks. Also, Living creatures who you touch, who touch you without your consent, or who succeed at a Melee Combat Check against you will suffer 1d6 points of loss from Ticker Value for each instance of contact. While Cloaked in Darkness is active, you also automatically gain all of the abilities from the Feature Primal Darkness without having to decrease your current Charge. Cloaked in Darkness remains active for 6 rounds + the Charge cost. When Cloaked in Darkness enters its last round of activity, as a Free Action you may continue the Presence for another 6 rounds by spending 1 additional Charge.
featureNote: You may only have one Arcane Presence active at a time. This effect will remain until dismissed or until you lose consciousness.

featureDesc: You can use the Arcane Power of Primal Darkness to attack your foes.
featureBenDesc: While Cloaked in Darkness is active, as a Partial action you may decrease your Charge Count by 1 to Manifest the Arcane Power of Darkbolt. While Darkbolt is active, you gain a Ranged Magic Attack that may be used as a Standard Attack action against 1 opponent each round. Your Darkbolt will deal +1d6 points of Ticker Value loss on a successful Ranged Magic Attack Check roll in addition to any normal Combat damage. Darkbolt must be re-manifested with 1 additional Charge each time your Cloaked in Darkness Power is renewed.

featureDesc: You can use the Arcane Power of Primal Darkness to enhance your weapon.

Darkblade does not incur any additional Charge loss to Manifest and remains active as long as Cloaked in Darkness and Empower Weapon are both active.
featureNote: If the weapon leaves your hand for more than one round, the effect is negated. This effect may only be used once per Encounter and only on a single weapon.

While Elite Shining Bolt is active, you gain the ability to target all allies that you can see within 50’ of yourself and each other with a Shining Bolt of energy that will add +1d12 points to each target’s Ticker Value. You may also use this ability against Undead, Infernal, and Demonic opponents as a Ranged Magic Attack. As a Standard Attack action against all such opponents each round, your Elite Shining Bolt will deal +1d12 points of Ticker Value loss to each affected target on a successful Ranged Magic Attack Check roll in addition to any normal Combat damage.

featureDesc: You can use the Arcane Power of Elite Light to enhance your weapon.
featureBenDesc: If you Manifest Elite Empower Weapon while Illuminate is active, your Elite Empowered Weapon will now automatically deal Radiant Damage with each attack and will cause an Undead, Infernal, or Demonic opponent to lose +2d10 points from its Ticker Value as additional damage on all successful Combat Check rolls. Elite Shining Blade does not incur any additional Charge loss to Manifest and remains active as long as Illuminate and Elite Empower Weapon are both active.
featureNote: If the weapon leaves your hand for more than one round, the effect is negated. This effect may only be used once per Encounter and only on a single weapon.

featureDesc: You have excelled in the ability to use your thoughts and emotions to bind Arcane Energy in order to effect the thoughts and emotions of others.
featureBenDesc: When using Arcane Magic to affect the Mental or Spiritual states of others, gain +1d12 to your Use Magic roll.

featureDesc: You can use Sorcery to Invoke the Power of Fear.
featureBenDesc: As a Standard action, decrease your Current Charge Count by 2 to manifest a feeling of dread in Living creatures who interact with you. While Elite Fear is active you gain a +1d12 bonus to all People Skills Check rolls for Intimidation. Also, you may use Elite Fear to target all Living creatures within a 15’ radius that you can see within 100' of yourself. You appear fearsome and intimidating to the targets. You may cause the targets of this ability to become afraid and unable to take any Attack actions during the current round. Targets affected by this ability may defend against attacks as normal but you gain a +1d12 bonus on all rolls made against any of the targets during the current round. As a free action once per round, you may change the area of this ability to another 15’ radius area that you can see within 100' of you. Each round that Elite Fear is active, you may choose to spend additional Charges to cause the currently affected targets to reduce their Current Modifier Values by 1d12 for each Charge spent this way. You may do this once per round as a Partial Action for as long as your Superior Fear remains active. You may spend any number of Charges on this action each round. Targeted individuals are allowed a Spiritual Defense Check roll against your Use Magic check in order to negate this loss. Once Manifested, Elite Fear remains active until the end of the Current Encounter.
featureNote: The effects of this Power will counter the effects from Elite Hope and negate the effects of both. This will overpower and negate the effects from all lesser Powers of Hope.

featureDesc: You can use the Arcane Power of Fear to protect you.
featureBenDesc: As a Full Round action, decrease your Charge Count by 5d4+5, to Manifest an Arcane Presence of Elite Fear. This Presence inspires dread in those who see you. While near you, others feel very frightened. While this Presence is active, all Living opponents who choose to engage with you during Combat must succeed at a Spiritual Defense Check against your Use Magic Check or else cower in fear and only take actions as commanded by you. You gain a +2d10 bonus to all rolls against such opponents. While Menace is active, you also automatically gain all of the abilities from the Feature Elite Fear without having to decrease your current Charge. Bound By Fear remains active until you become unconscious or until your Current Charge Count equals 0.
featureNote: You may only have one Arcane Presence active at a time. This effect will remain until dismissed or until you lose consciousness.

featureDesc: You can use the Arcane Power of Superior Fear to gain strength over your enemies.
featureBenDesc: While Menace is active, as a Partial action you may decrease your Charge Count by 3 to Manifest the Arcane Power of Absolute Panic. While Absolute Panic is active, you may speak and inspire dread in all targeted Living opponents that are within 30’ of you and that can hear you speak. Your Absolute Panic will cause the targets to become fearful and only able to take Move actions for up to 2d10 rounds. Targeted creatures will stop any current action and, if able, use their Move action to flee from you in any random direction for the duration of the effect. At the end of the duration, the affected targets must succeed at a Spiritual Defense check against 2d10 or else continue to flee and not return to combat.  Also, the affected targets will suffer a 2d10 point loss to their Modifier Values. If a target succeeds at a Spiritual Defense check against your Use Magic check, all effects are halved.
featureNote: This ability may only affect targets that are able to hear your words.

featureDesc: You can use Sorcery to Invoke the Elite Arcane Power of Hope.
featureBenDesc: As a Standard action, decrease your Current Charge Count by 3 to manifest a feeling of confidence and goodwill in all Living creatures within a 20’ radius area that you can see 100' from yourself. You may cause the targets of this ability to gain a +1d12 bonus on all rolls made during the current round. As a free action once per round, you may change the target of this ability to another 20’ radius location that you can see within 100' of you. Each round that Elite Hope is active, you may choose to touch one of the current targets and spend additional Charges to increase its Current Modifier Value by 1d12 for each Charge spent this way. You may do this once per round as a Partial Action for as long as your Elite Hope remains active and you are not currently engaged in Combat. You may spend any number of Charges on this action each round. Also, While Superior Hope is active you gain a +1d12 bonus to all People Skills Check rolls for Diplomacy.  Once Manifested, Elite Hope remains active until the end of the Current Encounter.
featureNote: The effects of this Power will counter the effects from Superior Fear and negate the effects of both. This will overpower and negate the effects of Expanded Fear.

featureDesc: You can use the Power of Hope inspire feelings of self-confidence.
featureBenDesc: As a Full Round action, decrease your Charge Count by 5d4+5, to Manifest an Arcane Presence of Elite Hope. This Presence inspires feelings of optimism and confidence within those who see you. Companions standing adjacent to you gain a +2d10 bonus to all rolls while positioned next to you. While this Presence is active, all Living opponents who choose to engage with you during Combat must succeed at a Spiritual Defense Check against your Use Magic Check or else decide that you are the Avatar of Hope and will defend you to the death against all attackers. While Embolden is active, you also automatically gain all of the abilities from the Feature Elite Hope without having to decrease your current Charge. Embolden remains active remains active until you become unconscious or until your Current Charge Count equals 0.
featureNote: You may only have one Arcane Presence active at a time. This effect will remain until dismissed or until you lose consciousness.

featureDesc: You can use the Arcane Power of Superior Hope to bolster your allies.
featureBenDesc: While Embolden is active, as a Partial action you may decrease your Charge Count by 2 to Manifest the Arcane Power of Absolute Reassurance. While Absolute Reassurance is active, you may take a Standard Action to speak and inspire supreme self-confidence in all Living creatures that are within 50’ of you and that can hear you speak. Your Absolute Reassurance will cause the targets to become hopeful and gain a +1d8 point increase to their Modifier Values. Living opponents affected by this ability will perceive you as a Beacon of Hope and will attempt to aid and defend you. Creatures affected in this way are allowed a Spiritual Defense check against you Use Magic to negate the effect.
featureNote: This ability may only affect targets that are able to hear your words.

featureDesc: You can use Sorcery to Invoke the Superior Arcane Power of Anger.
featureBenDesc: As a Standard action, decrease your Current Charge Count by 3 to manifest feelings of hatred and rage in all Living creatures that you can see in a 20’ radius within 100' of yourself. You may cause the targets of this ability to gain a +1d12 bonus to all Melee Combat rolls and +1d12 to additional damage dealt by Melee Combat made during the current round. As a free action once per round, you may change the 20’ radius location of this ability to another spot that you can see within 100' of you. Each round that Elite Anger is active, you may choose to touch one of the current targets and spend additional Charges to increase its Current Modifier Value by 1d12 for each Charge spent this way. You may do this once per round as a Partial Action for as long as your Elite Anger remains active and you are not currently engaged in Combat. You may spend any number of Charges on this action each round. Also, While Elite Anger is active you gain a +1d12 bonus to your Ticker Value.  Once Manifested, Elite Anger remains active until the end of the Current Encounter.
featureNote: The effects of this Power will counter the effects from Elite Tranquility and negate the effects of both. This will overpower and negate the effects of Superior Tranquility.

featureDesc: You can use the Superior Power of Anger to empower your actions and cloud the minds of your enemies with frustration.
featureBenDesc: As a Full Round action, decrease your Charge Count by 5d4+5, to Manifest an Arcane Presence of Elite Anger. This Presence inspires feelings of frustration and rage within those who see you. While near you, others feel very upset. Companions standing adjacent to you gain a +2d10 bonus to all Melee Combat rolls and additional damage from Melee combat while positioned next to you. While this Presence is active, all Living opponents who choose to engage with you during Combat must succeed at a Spiritual Defense Check against your Use Magic Check or else become irrationally angry and attack some other combat participant as determined by you. While Furious is active, you also automatically gain all of the abilities from the Feature Elite Anger without having to decrease your current Charge. Bound by Anger remains active remains active until you become unconscious or until your Current Charge Count equals 0.
featureNote: You may have only one Presence active at any one time. This effect will remain until dismissed or until you lose consciousness.

featureDesc: You can use the Arcane Power of Superior Anger to empower your allies.
featureBenDesc: While Furious is active, as a Partial action you may decrease your Charge Count by 2 to Manifest the Arcane Power of Absolute Hatred. While Absolute Hatred is active, you may take a Standard Action to speak and inspire rage in all Living creatures that are within 50’ of you and that can hear you speak. Your Absolute Hatred will cause the targets to become Enraged and gain a +1d8 bonus to Melee Combat rolls and +1d8 additional damage dealt by a successful Melee attack.
featureNote: This ability may only affect targets that are able to hear your words.
